# The Debate Framework

---

##

::: {style="font-size: 2.5em; font-weight: bold;"}
Today, we simplify the climate debate into two camps:
:::

---

## Two Sides. Two Worldviews.

::: {style="display: flex; justify-content: space-around; margin-top: 50px;"}
::: {style="text-align: center; width: 45%; background: #3498db; color: white; padding: 50px; border-radius: 15px;"}
::: {style="font-size: 2.5em; font-weight: bold;"}
PRO-AI
:::
::: {style="font-size: 1.3em; margin-top: 20px;"}
= Pro-Development

= "Pragmatic Progress"
:::
:::

::: {style="text-align: center; width: 45%; background: #27ae60; color: white; padding: 50px; border-radius: 15px;"}
::: {style="font-size: 2.5em; font-weight: bold;"}
PRO-US
:::
::: {style="font-size: 1.3em; margin-top: 20px;"}
= Pro-Human

= "People & Planet First"
:::
:::
:::

---

## PRO-AI: The Development Narrative

::: {style="background: #3498db; color: white; padding: 40px; border-radius: 10px; font-size: 1.4em; line-height: 1.8;"}
**Core belief:** Progress is the solution, not the problem.

**On AI:** Technology will solve climate change â€” we need *more* innovation, not less.

**On economy:** We can't afford to slow down. Jobs, growth, and stability come first.

**On climate activists:** Well-intentioned but naive. They don't understand how the real world works.

**Identity:** Pragmatists. Builders. Realists.
:::

---

## PRO-AI: Typical Arguments

::: {style="font-size: 1.5em; line-height: 1.8;"}
1. **AI optimizes everything** â€” energy grids, supply chains, agriculture

2. **Economic growth lifts people out of poverty** â€” that's the real humanitarian priority

3. **Renewables need AI** â€” to manage intermittent power, predict demand

4. **The IEA says** AI could reduce emissions by ~5% by 2035

5. **Slowing down = falling behind** â€” China won't wait for us
:::

---

## PRO-US: The Human Narrative

::: {style="background: #27ae60; color: white; padding: 40px; border-radius: 10px; font-size: 1.4em; line-height: 1.8;"}
**Core belief:** We can't tech our way out of a crisis caused by tech.

**On AI:** It's making things worse *right now*. The benefits are speculative; the harms are measurable.

**On economy:** "Growth" that destroys the planet isn't growth â€” it's suicide.

**On tech optimists:** They're selling hope to avoid responsibility.

**Identity:** Humanists. Protectors. Truth-tellers.
:::

---

## PRO-US: Typical Arguments

::: {style="font-size: 1.5em; line-height: 1.8;"}
1. **AI's energy costs are real and growing** â€” the benefits are theoretical

2. **We already have solutions** â€” policy, behavior change, existing tech. We just won't use them.

3. **The poor pay the price** â€” climate impacts hit the vulnerable; AI benefits the rich

4. **Tech companies have no accountability** â€” they promise "green AI" while burning coal

5. **Every delay = lives lost** â€” we don't have time to wait for innovation
:::

---

## Why This Framing?

::: {style="font-size: 1.6em; line-height: 1.8;"}
This isn't really about AI.

It's about **two competing stories** of what matters:

| PRO-AI | PRO-US |
|--------|--------|
| Progress | Preservation |
| Economy | Environment |
| Innovation | Restraint |
| Future potential | Present harm |
| Systems | People |

**These tensions appear in every climate debate.**
:::

---

##

::: {style="font-size: 2.5em; font-weight: bold; color: #8e44ad;"}
Your job today:

Pick a side.

Build a narrative.

**Make people care.**
:::

# How to Build a Story

---

##

::: {style="font-size: 2.5em; font-weight: bold; line-height: 1.5;"}
Facts inform.

**Spectacles** persuade.
:::

::: {style="font-size: 1.5em; margin-top: 40px; color: #7f8c8d;"}
This course is about stitching facts with arguments that are factual â€” but narrated in a way that **leaves a bigger impression**.
:::

---

## The Formula

::: {style="font-size: 1.8em; line-height: 1.8;"}
**Fact** + **Human Story** + **Stakes** = **Spectacle**
:::

::: {style="display: flex; justify-content: space-around; margin-top: 50px;"}
::: {style="text-align: center; width: 30%; background: #ecf0f1; padding: 30px; border-radius: 10px;"}
::: {style="font-size: 1.2em; font-weight: bold;"}
Weak
:::
"AI uses a lot of energy"
:::

::: {style="text-align: center; width: 30%; background: #f39c12; color: white; padding: 30px; border-radius: 10px;"}
::: {style="font-size: 1.2em; font-weight: bold;"}
Better
:::
"AI uses more electricity than Pakistan"
:::

::: {style="text-align: center; width: 30%; background: #e74c3c; color: white; padding: 30px; border-radius: 10px;"}
::: {style="font-size: 1.2em; font-weight: bold;"}
Spectacle
:::
"Your ChatGPT query costs a town its drinking water"
:::
:::

---

## PRO-US: Stories That Scare

::: {style="font-size: 1.4em; line-height: 1.7;"}
**The Human Cost:**

- A Rice University student took their own life â€” the pressure of competing with AI, feeling replaceable, was part of their struggle.
- "AI is taking your job" â€” not in 10 years, but **now**. Customer service, coding, writing, design.

**The Corporate Villain:**

- Big Tech is profiting off job opportunities that **went to PEOPLE** â€” and replacing them with algorithms.
- *"Every time you cheer for AI, you're voting to make yourself obsolete."*

**The Exploitation Angle:**

- Data centers are built in poor communities. They get the pollution. Tech workers get the raises.
- "Green AI" is marketing. The coal plants are real.
:::

---

## PRO-US: Make It Personal

::: {style="background: #27ae60; color: white; padding: 40px; border-radius: 15px; font-size: 1.5em; line-height: 1.8;"}
**Don't say:** "AI contributes to carbon emissions."

**Say:** "Your kid's asthma inhaler? That's because a data center needed to generate your meme."

**Don't say:** "Automation displaces workers."

**Say:** "Your dad worked 30 years in logistics. ChatGPT just made him obsolete. And you're celebrating?"
:::

---

## PRO-AI: Stories That Inspire

::: {style="font-size: 1.4em; line-height: 1.7;"}
**The Productivity Revolution:**

- A single person can now do what took a team of 10.
- Students in developing countries can access world-class tutoring â€” for free.
- Small businesses compete with giants because AI levels the playing field.

**The Innovation Hope:**

- AI is discovering new materials for solar panels, optimizing wind farms, predicting floods.
- *"The same technology that causes problems can solve them â€” if we invest."*

**The Realism Card:**

- "China isn't slowing down. Do you want to fall behind and have zero influence on how AI develops?"
- Stopping AI won't bring jobs back. Adapting will create new ones.
:::

---

## PRO-AI: Paint the Picture

::: {style="background: #3498db; color: white; padding: 40px; border-radius: 15px; font-size: 1.5em; line-height: 1.8;"}
**Don't say:** "AI improves efficiency."

**Say:** "A farmer in Kenya used AI to diagnose her crop disease in 30 seconds. Her village didn't starve."

**Don't say:** "We need technological progress."

**Say:** "My grandmother was diagnosed with cancer. AI caught it 6 months earlier than her doctor would have. She's alive because of that."
:::

---

## The Key Insight

::: {style="font-size: 2em; font-weight: bold; line-height: 1.6; text-align: center;"}
You're not lying.

You're **selecting** which truths to emphasize.

You're **framing** facts inside stories people can feel.
:::

::: {style="font-size: 1.4em; margin-top: 40px; text-align: center; color: #7f8c8d;"}
This is how every debate is won â€” climate, politics, business, life.
:::

---

## But Here's the Rule

::: {style="font-size: 2.5em; font-weight: bold; color: #c0392b; text-align: center;"}
Every story must be **fact-checkable**.
:::

::: {style="font-size: 1.6em; margin-top: 40px; text-align: center;"}
This is the line between **persuasion** and **propaganda**.
:::

---

## Spectacle â‰  Fake News

::: {style="display: flex; justify-content: space-around; margin-top: 30px;"}
::: {style="text-align: left; width: 45%; background: #27ae60; color: white; padding: 30px; border-radius: 10px;"}
::: {style="font-size: 1.5em; font-weight: bold;"}
Persuasion (OK)
:::
::: {style="font-size: 1.2em; line-height: 1.6; margin-top: 15px;"}
- Selecting **real** facts
- Framing **verified** stories
- Emphasizing **documented** impacts
- Using **sourced** statistics
- Making real data **vivid**
:::
:::

::: {style="text-align: left; width: 45%; background: #e74c3c; color: white; padding: 30px; border-radius: 10px;"}
::: {style="font-size: 1.5em; font-weight: bold;"}
Propaganda (NOT OK)
:::
::: {style="font-size: 1.2em; line-height: 1.6; margin-top: 15px;"}
- Inventing stories
- Fabricating statistics
- Making up "examples"
- Exaggerating beyond evidence
- Claiming things you can't verify
:::
:::
:::

---

## The Test

::: {style="font-size: 1.8em; line-height: 1.8;"}
Before you use a story, ask:

1. **Can I cite a source?** (news article, study, report)

2. **Could someone fact-check this?** (and find it's true)

3. **Am I framing reality or inventing it?**
:::

::: {style="font-size: 1.5em; margin-top: 40px; background: #f39c12; padding: 20px; border-radius: 10px;"}
**If you can't answer YES to all three â€” don't use it.**
:::

---

## Example: The Rice University Story

::: {style="font-size: 1.4em; line-height: 1.8;"}
**Fact-checkable:** Yes â€” this was reported in news media.

**Verifiable:** The student's struggles with AI pressure were documented.

**Framing:** We're emphasizing a real case to illustrate broader concerns about AI's psychological impact on young people.

**NOT OK:** Claiming "hundreds of students have died because of AI" without evidence.
:::

::: {style="font-size: 1.3em; margin-top: 30px; color: #7f8c8d;"}
*The story is powerful because it's real â€” not because we invented it.*
:::

---

##

::: {style="font-size: 2.2em; font-weight: bold; line-height: 1.6;"}
Emotions need **reality** backing them.

Your job: Find the **real stories** that make people feel.

Not invent them.
:::

---

##

::: {style="font-size: 2.2em; font-weight: bold; color: #c0392b; line-height: 1.6;"}
Your audience doesn't remember data.

They remember how you made them **feel**.

Angry. Hopeful. Scared. Inspired.

**That's the spectacle.**
:::

## Presentation Countdown

<div id="timer-container" style="text-align: center;">
  <div id="timer" style="
    font-size: 300px;
    color: black;
    margin-bottom: 20px;">05:00</div>

  <button id="start-button" style="
    font-size: 24px;
    padding: 20px 40px;
    background-color: #3498db;
    color: white;
    border: none;
    border-radius: 8px;
    cursor: pointer;
    margin-right: 10px;">
    Start Timer
  </button>
  <button id="reset-button" style="
    font-size: 24px;
    padding: 20px 40px;
    background-color: #e74c3c;
    color: white;
    border: none;
    border-radius: 8px;
    cursor: pointer;">
    Reset Timer
  </button>
</div>

<script>
  let countdownDuration = 300;
  let initialDuration = 300;
  let timerInterval;

  function formatTime(seconds) {
    const minutes = Math.floor(seconds / 60);
    const remainingSeconds = seconds % 60;
    return `${minutes.toString().padStart(2, '0')}:${remainingSeconds.toString().padStart(2, '0')}`;
  }

  function updateTimer() {
    const timerElement = document.getElementById("timer");
    if (countdownDuration > 0) {
      countdownDuration--;
      timerElement.innerText = formatTime(countdownDuration);
      if (countdownDuration < 60) {
        timerElement.style.color = "#e74c3c";
      } else {
        timerElement.style.color = "black";
      }
    } else {
      timerElement.innerText = "TIME";
      timerElement.style.color = "#e74c3c";
      clearInterval(timerInterval);
    }
  }

  document.getElementById("start-button").addEventListener("click", function () {
    clearInterval(timerInterval);
    timerInterval = setInterval(updateTimer, 1000);
    this.disabled = true;
    this.innerText = "Running...";
  });

  document.getElementById("reset-button").addEventListener("click", function () {
    clearInterval(timerInterval);
    countdownDuration = initialDuration;
    const timerElement = document.getElementById("timer");
    timerElement.innerText = formatTime(countdownDuration);
    timerElement.style.color = "black";
    const startButton = document.getElementById("start-button");
    startButton.disabled = false;
    startButton.innerText = "Start Timer";
  });
</script>
